Thomas has been a prolific scorer throughout his career and we re excited to add his offence and experience to help with the continued growth of our forwards," said GM Jim Benning.  His skill and ability to contribute on the scoresheet, combined with his lead-by-example style will help our team this year, and will benefit our younger players as they continue to develop their game."

caption: #Canucks sign @andersnilsson31 to a two-year contract.  Anders has a big, athletic frame and we expect that he will compete at high level when called upon,  said GM Jim Benning.  Alongside Jacob, we feel his addition will continue to make us competitive every night at the goaltending position.
caption_raw: #Canucks sign @andersnilsson31 to a two-year contract. “Anders has a big, athletic frame and we expect that he will compete at high level when called upon,” said GM Jim Benning. “Alongside Jacob, we feel his addition will continue to make us competitive every night at the goaltending position.”

caption: #Canucks sign Alexander Burmistrov to a one-year contract.  Alexander put up good numbers towards the end of last season with Arizona and has shown good offensive potential throughout his young career,  said GM Jim Benning.  We re excited to give him an opportunity to help our team compete next year.
caption_raw: #Canucks sign Alexander Burmistrov to a one-year contract. “Alexander put up good numbers towards the end of last season with Arizona and has shown good offensive potential throughout his young career,” said GM Jim Benning. “We’re excited to give him an opportunity to help our team compete next year.”

caption: #Canucks sign Anton Rodin to a one-year contract.  Anton is a good offensive player who I know feels has a lot to prove,  said GM Jim Benning.  He had a tough season last year with injuries but with his work ethic, we re excited that he ll return to the team healthy and ready to contribute.
caption_raw: #Canucks sign Anton Rodin to a one-year contract. “Anton is a good offensive player who I know feels has a lot to prove,” said GM Jim Benning. “He had a tough season last year with injuries but with his work ethic, we’re excited that he’ll return to the team healthy and ready to contribute.”

caption: #Canucks sign @mdzofficial to a two-year contract.  Michael is a mobile, playmaking defenceman who adds depth and scoring to our blue line,  said GM Jim Benning.  His ability to log big minutes and contribute in all situations will help our team be competitive every night.
caption_raw: #Canucks sign @mdzofficial to a two-year contract. “Michael is a mobile, playmaking defenceman who adds depth and scoring to our blue line,” said GM Jim Benning. “His ability to log big minutes and contribute in all situations will help our team be competitive every night.”

caption: #Canucks sign Patrick Wiercioch to a one-year contract. "Patrick has excellent mobility for a player his size and possesses a big shot from the point," said GM Jim Benning. "He'll add to our depth on the blue line and we're excited to give him the opportunity to play for his hometown team."
caption_raw: #Canucks sign Patrick Wiercioch to a one-year contract. "Patrick has excellent mobility for a player his size and possesses a big shot from the point," said GM Jim Benning. "He'll add to our depth on the blue line and we're excited to give him the opportunity to play for his hometown team."

caption: #Canucks sign @sgagner89 to a three-year contract. "Sam is a hardworking, right shot centre with good speed and skill," said GM Jim Benning. "He brings tremendous experience to our team and will set a good example for our younger players."
caption_raw: #Canucks sign @sgagner89 to a three-year contract. "Sam is a hardworking, right shot centre with good speed and skill," said GM Jim Benning. "He brings tremendous experience to our team and will set a good example for our younger players."

caption: #Canucks GM Jim Benning announced today that forward Brendan Gaunce will undergo shoulder surgery tomorrow. "Brendan sustained a shoulder injury in March and has been working closely with our medical team," said Benning. "After a period of rehabilitation and observation, Brendan and our medical team have deemed, that based on his response to treatment, the best course of action is to undergo surgery for injury management and preparation for next season."
caption_raw: #Canucks GM Jim Benning announced today that forward Brendan Gaunce will undergo shoulder surgery tomorrow. "Brendan sustained a shoulder injury in March and has been working closely with our medical team," said Benning. "After a period of rehabilitation and observation, Brendan and our medical team have deemed, that based on his response to treatment, the best course of action is to undergo surgery for injury management and preparation for next season."

caption:
Getting your first Vancouver Canucks jersey is a memorable moment. After putting it on, your chest immediately swells with pride and it feels like you're standing alongside the team. It's a #WeAreAllCanucks moment and it's not to be taken lightly.

Baylee Bjorge is now part of the team.

Baylee Bjorge? Baylee Bjorge that name sounds familiar. Indeed. She's the 21-year-old who took @bboeser to prom last summer.

Reaching out to Boeser over Instagram, Bjorge, a huge hockey fan born with Down syndrome, was the talk of Grand Forks, North Dakota, after being escorted to prom by the then University of North Dakota star forward.

When Boeser's season ended at UND this year and he made the jump to the Canucks, so did Bjorge. No one was quicker to retweet the latest Boeser news than her.

Bjorge is now literally wearing her pride on her sleeve after her mom Katie surprised her with a Boeser Canucks jersey as an early birthday gift.

I think it might be getting a bit dusty in here  "He'll be home to sign it for you," says Katie to an elated Baylee, who cries "tears of joy." Boeser has stayed in touch with the family since prom last May and said Baylee is "a great girl" - a great girl who will soon have a great autograph on a great jersey.

Welcome to the team Baylee!

caption:
Every game, there s a tweet.

Is there a guy on the Canucks named Shampoo?

No, no there is not.  I ve heard so many variations of my last name over the years,  laughed Canucks forward Michael Chaput.  Cha-put, Cha-poo, Cha-piew, Ka-put, and ya, Shampoo. I ve heard it so many different ways, I just answer to it all now.  Link in bio to one foamy Fort Nucks story.
caption_raw:
Every game, there’s a tweet.

Is there a guy on the Canucks named Shampoo?

No, no there is not. “I’ve heard so many variations of my last name over the years,” laughed Canucks forward Michael Chaput. “Cha-put, Cha-poo, Cha-piew, Ka-put, and ya, Shampoo. I’ve heard it so many different ways, I just answer to it all now.” Link in bio to one foamy Fort Nucks story.

caption: Markus Granlund to undergo wrist surgery; a projected timeline on his full recovery will be provided post-surgery. "Markus has had an ongoing wrist injury which we've treated through regular maintenance and rehabilitation," said GM Jim Benning. "Our Canucks medical team and Markus believe that surgery is the best course of action for his long-term health and by having the procedure now it will allow him to have more time to rehabilitate and work out in preparation for next season. Markus is an important part of our team and we are confident he'll have a full recovery.
caption_raw: Markus Granlund to undergo wrist surgery; a projected timeline on his full recovery will be provided post-surgery. "Markus has had an ongoing wrist injury which we've treated through regular maintenance and rehabilitation," said GM Jim Benning. "Our Canucks medical team and Markus believe that surgery is the best course of action for his long-term health and by having the procedure now it will allow him to have more time to rehabilitate and work out in preparation for next season. Markus is an important part of our team and we are confident he'll have a full recovery.”

caption: #Canucks sign 20-year-old defenceman Jalen Chatfield of @SpitsHockey to a three-year entry-level contract. "Jalen is a good two-way defenceman that sees the ice well and makes good decisions in all three zones," said #Canucks GM Jim Benning. "He moves the puck well and can join the rush. Jalen is another addition to our young prospect pool and we look forward to his continued development playing in Windsor.

"Jalen is a good two-way defenceman that sees the ice well and makes good decisions in all three zones," said #Canucks GM Jim Benning. "He moves the puck well and can join the rush. Jalen is another addition to our young prospect pool and we look forward to his continued development playing in Windsor.”

caption:
Joseph Cramarossa was in a reclined plastic chair overlooking an infinity pool, overlooking the Pacific Ocean in Cabo San Lucas, Mexico, with three minutes until the 2017 trade deadline.

He didn t get a call from the Anaheim Ducks letting him know he d been placed on waivers, so he wasn t expecting a call if someone claimed him.

Insert Twitter.

Alongside Ducks defenceman Josh Manson, Cramarossa scrolled and scrolled and scrolled.  I left Twitter because I got a text and of course that s when news dropped. Manson turned to me and said: Vancouver! I was so excited.
caption_raw:
Joseph Cramarossa was in a reclined plastic chair overlooking an infinity pool, overlooking the Pacific Ocean in Cabo San Lucas, Mexico, with three minutes until the 2017 trade deadline.

He didn’t get a call from the Anaheim Ducks letting him know he’d been placed on waivers, so he wasn’t expecting a call if someone claimed him.

Insert Twitter.

Alongside Ducks defenceman Josh Manson, Cramarossa scrolled and scrolled and scrolled. “I left Twitter because I got a text and of course that’s when news dropped. Manson turned to me and said: Vancouver! I was so excited.”

caption: Regram from @bcchf: "Greatest gift this year was the visit from the Canucks and Owen getting to spend time with the players and make it a normal day. Owen was a Toyota Junior Trainer for a game in September. He got to sit on the bench for warm-up, meet the guys, have a tour and watch the game which he has never been able to do in person before. That was right before he got sick. Him having that hockey experience this year is even more important to us now because that is the only one he gets this year - because he doesn t get to play now." All the best to Owen and his family this holiday season.
caption_raw: Regram from @bcchf: "Greatest gift this year was the visit from the Canucks and Owen getting to spend time with the players and make it a normal day. Owen was a Toyota Junior Trainer for a game in September. He got to sit on the bench for warm-up, meet the guys, have a tour and watch the game which he has never been able to do in person before. That was right before he got sick. Him having that hockey experience this year is even more important to us now because that is the only one he gets this year - because he doesn’t get to play now." All the best to Owen and his family this holiday season.

caption:
Message from Derek Dorsett (Twigy15) on Twitter: 
Been a tough week with a hard decision for surgery but would like to thank the Canucks org, teammates and fans for all the support!

Want to send a huge thanks to Dr. Watkins Sr./Jr. & the rest of the staff at Marina Del Rey Hospital for the great care.

Can't wait to start rehab and be 100% healthy and ready to play again. Going to miss being on the ice and competing with my teammates.
caption_raw:
Message from Derek Dorsett (Twigy15) on Twitter: 
Been a tough week with a hard decision for surgery but would like to thank the Canucks org, teammates and fans for all the support!

Want to send a huge thanks to Dr. Watkins Sr./Jr. & the rest of the staff at Marina Del Rey Hospital for the great care.

Can't wait to start rehab and be 100% healthy and ready to play again. Going to miss being on the ice and competing with my teammates.

caption:
We're receiving some heartwarming #MyMattias  stories - keep them coming! Tell us about your mentor and you could win big. (link in bio to contest rules)

Regram @marcuskeller10: This is my Mattias. (We're the ones on the left.) That is my grandpa, Wayne Gottschau. From a young age I spent more time around him than any other adult in my life. From kindergarten to grade 4 he drove me from his house in Burnaby to Poco and back everyday to go to school. He taught me everything I know about hockey and passed everything he knew about the game of hockey and more onto me. He's been the sole person who moulded me into the person I am today and without him I'm not quite sure where I'd be today. #MyMattias  gives a whole new meaning to the word grandpa. Thanks @dorway99.
caption_raw:
We're receiving some heartwarming #MyMattias✌️️ stories - keep them coming! Tell us about your mentor and you could win big. (link in bio to contest rules)

Regram @marcuskeller10: This is my Mattias. (We're the ones on the left.) That is my grandpa, Wayne Gottschau. From a young age I spent more time around him than any other adult in my life. From kindergarten to grade 4 he drove me from his house in Burnaby to Poco and back everyday to go to school. He taught me everything I know about hockey and passed everything he knew about the game of hockey and more onto me. He's been the sole person who moulded me into the person I am today and without him I'm not quite sure where I'd be today. #MyMattias✌️ gives a whole new meaning to the word grandpa. Thanks @dorway99.

caption:
Who's your Mattias?

Mattias Ohlund was a mentor to many during his time with the Canucks providing invaluable leadership to many. Mentors, be it teachers, coaches, councillors, parents or peers, help development by providing life-changing advice and support.

To celebrate Ohlund s induction into the Canucks Ring of Honour, we d like to send you and  your Mattias  to the game on December 16th, which includes a meet and greet with Ohlund. Post a photo of you and your mentor explaining the difference they ve made in your life and why they re worthy of this special night out. Include #MyMattias
caption_raw:
Who's your Mattias?

Mattias Ohlund was a mentor to many during his time with the Canucks providing invaluable leadership to many. Mentors, be it teachers, coaches, councillors, parents or peers, help development by providing life-changing advice and support.

To celebrate Ohlund’s induction into the Canucks Ring of Honour, we’d like to send you and “your Mattias” to the game on December 16th, which includes a meet and greet with Ohlund. Post a photo of you and your mentor explaining the difference they’ve made in your life and why they’re worthy of this special night out. Include #MyMattias✌️

caption: #Canucks General Manager Jim Benning confirmed today that the club is exploring trade options for forward Chris Higgins.  As part of our transition to a younger team, I can confirm we re exploring trade options for Chris Higgins so we can create more roster space for our younger players to develop. Chris is a quality person who has been an important member of our team for nearly five seasons. Our focus has been on finding a positive new situation for him and we will continue to do so.
caption_raw: #Canucks General Manager Jim Benning confirmed today that the club is exploring trade options for forward Chris Higgins. “As part of our transition to a younger team, I can confirm we’re exploring trade options for Chris Higgins so we can create more roster space for our younger players to develop. Chris is a quality person who has been an important member of our team for nearly five seasons. Our focus has been on finding a positive new situation for him and we will continue to do so.”

caption:
Yep, that's our very own @h_s_9 doing the weather last night for CHAT TV News in Medicine Hat. 
From Hunter: "It was great. I've always wanted to do something like that so when I got the chance, I decided to do it. I was super nervous, but I got to try it a few times so by the time I did it, it wasn't to hard. It was live so the first few seconds when I was doing it were tough, but I had a lot of fun and I felt like I did pretty well."

caption:
Over 100 Canucks, Aramark & Aquilini Investment Group and CLAC employees are volunteering with the Greater Vancouver Food Bank Society today harvesting potatoes in the Fraser Valley.

Canucks croppers will help harvest over 30,000 of potatoes; the Vancouver Food Bank assists over 28,000 people weekly through the Lower Mainland.

There's a lot of work getting done, but also time for some fun! #HarvestDay

caption: Vancouver Canucks President and General Manager Michael D. Gillis announced today that John Tortorella has been named Head Coach of the Vancouver Canucks. Tortorella becomes the 17th Head Coach in club history.  We are proud to introduce John Tortorella as Head Coach of the Vancouver Canucks,  said Michael D. Gillis, President and General Manager, Canucks Sports & Entertainment.  John has led teams to championships at every level of coaching and is passionate about winning. He has a proven ability to bring the best out of his players and we believe he has all of the qualities to bring our team success.
caption_raw: Vancouver Canucks President and General Manager Michael D. Gillis announced today that John Tortorella has been named Head Coach of the Vancouver Canucks. Tortorella becomes the 17th Head Coach in club history. “We are proud to introduce John Tortorella as Head Coach of the Vancouver Canucks,” said Michael D. Gillis, President and General Manager, Canucks Sports & Entertainment. “John has led teams to championships at every level of coaching and is passionate about winning. He has a proven ability to bring the best out of his players and we believe he has all of the qualities to bring our team success.”
